details:
Several vulnerabilities were fixed in Wireshark, a network sniffer.


* [CVE-2019-13619](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13619)
ASN.1 BER and related dissectors crash
* [CVE-2019-16319](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-16319)
The Gryphon dissector could go into an infinite loop.
* [CVE-2019-19553](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-19553)
The CMS dissector could crash.
* [CVE-2020-7045](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-7045)
The BT ATT dissector could crash.
* [CVE-2020-9428](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-9428)
The EAP dissector could crash.
* [CVE-2020-9430](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-9430)
The WiMax DLMAP dissector could crash.
* [CVE-2020-9431](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-9431)
The LTE RRC dissector could leak memory.
* [CVE-2020-11647](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-11647)
The BACapp dissector could crash.
* [CVE-2020-13164](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-13164)
The NFS dissector could crash.
* [CVE-2020-15466](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-15466)
The GVCP dissector could go into an infinite loop.
* [CVE-2020-25862](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-25862)
The TCP dissector could crash.
* [CVE-2020-25863](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-25863)
The MIME Multipart dissector could crash.
* [CVE-2020-26418](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-26418)
Memory leak in the Kafka protocol dissector.
* [CVE-2020-26421](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-26421)
Crash in USB HID protocol dissector.
* [CVE-2020-26575](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-26575)
The Facebook Zero Protocol (aka FBZERO) dissector could enter an infinite loop.
* [CVE-2020-28030](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-28030)
The GQUIC dissector could crash.


For Debian 9 stretch, these problems have been fixed in version
2.6.20-0+deb9u1.


We recommend that you upgrade your wireshark packages.


For the detailed security status of wireshark please refer to
its security tracker page at:
<https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/wireshark>


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
